channel.title: algorithms on Fresh Swift
channel.description: Recent content in algorithms on Fresh Swift

item.title: 5 Complex Algorithms Simplified Using Swift’s Higher-Order Functions
item.description: Higher-order functions accept one or more functions as arguments, return a function, or do both. Swift's higher-order functions, such as map and reduce, enable us to implement complex algorithms in a simplified manner. In this post, Lee Kah Seng provides five examples of such implementations.

item.title: Swift Algorithms - Sum of First N Natural Numbers
item.description: Károly Nyisztor with a short video comparing two Swift algorithms for calculating the sum of the first N natural numbers. One algorithm executes in linear time, while the other executes in constant time.
